content:
Diagnosis:	Prostate cancer - T1c N0 M0 acinar adenocarcinoma, Gleason 3+4 (Grade Group 2)

Initial PSA 6.8 ng/mL (January 2024). Underwent template prostate biopsies on 15 February 2024 confirming diagnosis.

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. He completed his radical radiotherapy course (74Gy in 37 fractions) on 12 April 2024 and has recovered well with minimal side effects. His urinary symptoms have largely settled, though he reports occasional mild frequency. Bowel function has returned to normal.

His latest PSA has fallen appropriately to 2.1 ng/mL (15 May 2024). Clinical examination today was unremarkable.

He remains well with PS 0 and has returned to his usual activities including regular golf.

The plan is to continue on his current hormone therapy (Prostap 3-monthly) for a total of 2 years as previously discussed. His next injection is due in 3 weeks. We will review him again in clinic in 3 months with repeat PSA.

patient_facts.value: Returned to usual activities including regular golf

status_updates.value: Early stage prostate cancer treated with radical radiotherapy. Good treatment response with appropriate PSA decline and minimal side effects
PSA fallen appropriately to 2.1 ng/mL with good recovery from radiotherapy
Minimal radiotherapy side effects with largely settled urinary symptoms and normal bowel function
Review in clinic in 3 months with repeat PSA
